Franska is located In the Lund Salhullen.  Decided to give it a try for lunch based on their 2017 White award.

It was busy on a Dec. Saturday and I was seated after a 20 minute wait.  First time here so went with the Fish...More

I was there with a group of business partners and tried tree dishes. The entry with scalops  was perfectly cooked, main dish of halibut was the best fish i've ever tasted but the dessert of creme brulle was not exactly what I was hoping for....More

I have been here just for lunch and I like the elegance and the service.
The price is a little bit on the high range, for a lunch restaurant.

Located in the food hall in the centre of the city. Had fried clams and my daughter had Wallenbergare. Both dished were absolutely delicious. My clams like them I had in Lyon. Nice staff and nice restaurant. Go here!!!

column7: The worst fish I have eaten.
column9: Service was ordinary but the food was absolutely not worth the money. The fried fish was floating in grease and nearly raw. I will not go here again.
Offering a range of Swedish classics with a french touch, I highly recommend this place for an easy going lunch. Staff were very friendly and the atmosphere was perfect!

We ordered the steak and it was delicious..perfectly cooked (medium) and the sides were well made although the fries were a bit too salty for my taste. Yet i appreciated the fact that the bearnaise sauce was served on the side so you can put...More

The food was very good. Me and my family tried the seafood menu. It was perfect exept for one bad langoustine. The staff exchanged it immediately to a good one. The staff was good but they could have been more observant. That aside, they were...More

column7: Good value on old French favorites
column9: The menu is standard Parisian bistro favorites but the service and wine list are quite good. Dining outside too in the Swedish summer is pleasant if the nearby major bus stop sometimes diverts attention from the food and conversation.

column7: three course menu is a good value
column9: It was an evening out with relatives from out of town.  We wanted good food and a place to share our time together.  Gamla Franska was a good fit.

A bit of France in Lund. The food was a true craftsmanship and very well though true. You could tell that the ingredients had a good quality. Together with the great atmosphere and very nice staff, it was a delightful evening!

column7: First time here but certainly not the last
column9:
Came in on a Monday to celebrate a special event for us and was not a lot of guests - but still energetic service, tasty food and very good wine.

The tables are placed very close together so if the restaurant is crowded it can be tricky to navigate around the tables. But the food and the service is very good so it is worth it!

Recently opened french inspired restaurant situated in the markethall in the center of Lund. 
First visit here for lunch and it was a pleasant surprise. 
The meny had a really good selection of dishes including coq au vin, baked fish, fish soup, a vegetarian dish...More

column7: Wanna be quality but no flavour and without the little extra for the price
